title: Gallery of lost theatrical opening title cards and studio logos
content:
There are some amazing examples of vintage animated film title typography and artwork at Jerry Beck's Cartoon Research. Link via [Coudal](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141314/http:/www.coudal.com/).   
   
 [http://www.cartoonresearch.com/titles.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141314/http:/www.cartoonresearch.com/titles.html)
author: grant

comments.content:
Wow! What a great site. One of my big interests outside of type is animation.   
   
About the Terrytoons logo... The guy who did that--Gene Deitch--has had a pretty interesting life. You can read [his autobiography](%22http://genedeitch.awn.com/index.php3?ltype=cover%22) online. (This was one of the links I contributed during my little stint as a guest contributor at Coudal. Happily, it's still up.)

Check out some of Deitch's early illustration work from the '40s from [Chapter 11](%22http://genedeitch.awn.com/index.php3?ltype=chapter&chapter=11%22):   
   
 ![deitch](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141314im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/20855.gif)

hmm - vaguely on the subject of early film typography. some of these 'coming soon'slides etc are q interesting   
   
check out hoot gibson-
